intro: Bulbocodium numidicum, commonly known as the Numidian bulbous gentian, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, gray-green leaves and produces showy blue or purple flowers during the summer months. The plant is part of the Gentianaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
